    public class ReaderArgumentReader
implements ArgumentReader

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other) 
      int getAvailableCount()
      Returns guaranteed amount of text you can safely read at the moment
      int getLength()
      Returns the sum of already read text length and ReaderArgumentReader.getAvailableCount. Might not return actual full text length until ReaderArgumentReader.hasNext returns false
      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if the underlying source can read more characters, false otherwise
      int hashCode() 
      void mark()
      Marks current position in case there's a possibility you will need to go back
      char next()
      Returns next character from the underlying source
      java.lang.String read(int count)
      Reads count next characters and returns them
      boolean removeMark()
      Removes last mark (doesn't return to it)
      boolean reset()
      Removes last mark and returns to it
      void skip(int count)
      Skips count characters.
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Method Detail

      • skip

        public void skip(int count)

        Skips count characters.

        Parameters:
        count - amount of characters meant to be skipped
        Throws:
        - if underlying source isn't long enough

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(int count)

        Reads count next characters and returns them

        Returns:
        string of length count
        Throws:
        - if underlying source isn't long enough

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()

        Returns true if the underlying source can read more characters, false otherwise

        Returns:
        whether you can read safely read more characters (at least 1)

      • next

        public char next()

        Returns next character from the underlying source

        Throws:
        - if underlying source is empty

      • getLength

        public int getLength()

        Returns the sum of already read text length and ReaderArgumentReader.getAvailableCount. Might not return actual full text length until ReaderArgumentReader.hasNext returns false

        See Also:
        ReaderArgumentReader.getAvailableCount, ReaderArgumentReader.hasNext

      • getAvailableCount

        public int getAvailableCount()

        Returns guaranteed amount of text you can safely read at the moment

      • mark

        public void mark()

        Marks current position in case there's a possibility you will need to go back

      • removeMark

        public boolean removeMark()

        Removes last mark (doesn't return to it)

        Returns:
        true if removed mark, false otherwise (no marks)

      • reset

        public boolean reset()

        Removes last mark and returns to it

        Returns:
        true if removed mark and returned, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
